function.name: validate
function.desc: Validates the selected form.
function.longdesc:
This method adds, by default, a submit-event-handler to the form and keyup and blur handlers to each element within the form.
Validation rules can be specified via the rules-option or via metadata (requires metadata plugin). Messages can be left out (there is a default message for each method), specified via the messages-option or via the title-attribute on each element.

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the validate. All options are optional.

option.name: errorClass
option.desc: Use this class to create error labels, to look for existing error labels and to add it to invalid elements.

option.name: wrapper
option.desc: Wrap error labels with the specified element.

option.name: debug
option.desc: If true, the form is not submitted and certain errors are display on the console (requires [http://getfirebug.com Firebug or Firebug lite]).

option.name: submitHandler
option.desc: Callback for handling the actual submit when the form is valid. Gets the form as the only argmument. Replaces the default submit.

option.default: rules are read from metadata via metadata plugin
option.name: rules
option.desc: Key/value pairs defining custom rules. Key is the ID or name (for radio/checkbox inputs) of an element, value is an object consisting of rule/parameter pairs, eg. {required: true, min: 3}. Once specified, metadata rules are completely ignored.

option.default: the default message for the method is used
option.name: messages
option.desc: Key/value pairs defining custom messages. Key is the name of an element, value the message to display for that element. Instead of a plain message another map with specific messages for each rule can be used. Can be specified for one or more elements. Overrides the title attribute of an element. Each message can be a String or a Function. The Function is called with the element as the first and the validator as the second argument and must return a String to display as the message for that element.

option.name: onsubmit
option.desc: Validate the form on submit. Set to false to use only other events for validation (option event).

option.name: onblur
option.desc: Validate elements (except checkboxes/radio buttons) on blur. If nothing is entered, all rules are skipped, except when the field was already marked as invalid.

option.name: onkeyup
option.desc: Validate elements on keyup. As long as the field is not marked as invalid, nothing happens. Otherwise, all rules are checked on each key up event.

option.name: onclick
option.desc: Validate checkboxes and radio buttons on click.

option.name: meta
option.desc: In case you use metadata for other plugins, too, you want to wrap your validation rules into their own object that can be specified via this option.

option.name: errorContainer
option.desc: Hide and show this container when validating.

option.name: errorContainer
option.desc: Hide and show this container when validating.

option.name: showErrors
option.desc: A custom message display handler. Gets the map of errors as the first argument and and array of errors as the second, called in the context of the validator object. The arguments contain only those elements currently validated, which can be a single element when doing validation onblur/keyup. You can trigger (in addition to your own messages) the default behaviour by calling this.defaultShowErrors().

option.default: Places the error label [[Manipulation/insertAfter|after]] the invalid element
option.name: errorPlacement
option.desc: Used to customize placement of created error labels. First argument: The created error label as a jQuery object. Second argument: The invalid element as a jQuery object.

option.name: success
option.desc: If specified, the error label is displayed to show a valid element. If a String is given, its added as a class to the label. If a Function is given, its called with the label (as a jQuery object) as its only argument. That can be used to add a text like "ok!".

option.name: focusInvalid
option.desc: Focus the last active or first invalid element on submit via validator.focusInvalid().

option.name: focusCleanup
option.desc: If enabled, removes the errorClass from the invalid elements and hides all errors messages whenever the element is focused. Avoid combination with focusInvalid.

option.name: ignore
option.desc: Elements to ignore when validating, simply filtering them out. jQuery's not-method is used, therefore everything that is accepted by not() can be passed as this option. Inputs of type submit and reset are always ignored, so are disabled elements.

option.name: subformRequired
option.desc: Called to determine if a subform is required. An input is passed as the argument, and a boolean is expected to return: If it returns false, the input is part of an optional subform, therefore not required.

function.name: valid
function.desc: Validates the selected form or elements.
function.longdesc: validate() needs to be called on the form before checking it using this method. Shortcut for the validator API.

example.desc: Sets up validation for a form, then checks if the form is valid.

selector.name: blank
selector.desc: Matches elements with a blank value
selector.longdesc:
Blank means either no value at all or only whitespace.
The implementation does a check like this: jQuery.trim(value).length == 0

example.desc: Finds input elements with no value or just whitespace.
example.inhead: <script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
example.html: <input value=""/><input value=" "/><input value="abc"/>

selector.name: filled
selector.longdesc:
filled means any value, but not only whitespace.
The implementation does a check like this: jQuery.trim(value).length > 0

example.desc: Finds input elements with no value or just whitespace.
example.inhead: <script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
example.html: <input value=""/><input value=" "/><input value="abc"/>

selector.name: unchecked
selector.desc: Matches all elements that are unchecked.

example.desc: Finds all input elements that are unchecked.
example.inhead: <script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
example.css: div { color:red; }
example.results: [ <input type="checkbox" name="newsletter" checked="checked" value="Daily" />, <input type="checkbox" name="newsletter" checked="checked" value="Monthly" /> ]

function.name: form
function.desc: Validates the form, returns true if it is valid, false otherwise.
function.longdesc: This behaves as a normal submit event, but returns the result.

example.desc: Triggers form validation programmatically.

function.name: element
function.desc: Validates a single element, returns true if it is valid, false otherwise.
function.longdesc: This behaves as validation on blur or keyup, but returns the result.

params.name: element
params.desc: An element to validate, must be inside the validated form.

example.desc: Triggers element validation programmatically.

function.name: refresh
function.desc: Call to refresh a form after new elements have been added or rules changed.
function.longdesc: Accepts an optional argument to refresh only a part of the form, eg. only the newly added element.

params.name: selection
params.desc: Refresh only the given elements, instead of the entire form

example.desc: Refrehes the validator after the form has changed.
Refreshes the validator after a new element has been added.

function.name: resetForm
function.desc: Resets the controlled form.
function.longdesc: Resets input fields to their original value (requires form plugin), removes classes indicating invalid elements and hides error messages.

example.desc: Reset the form controlled by this validator.

function.name: showErrors
function.desc: Show the specified messages.
function.longdesc: Keys have to refer to the names of elements, values are displayed for those elements, using the configured error placement.

params.name: errors
params.desc: One or more key/value pairs of input names and messages.

example.desc: Adds and shows error message programmatically.
example.code: var validator = $("#myform").validate(); validator.showErrors({"firstname": "I know that your firstname is Pete, Pete!"});

function.name: setDefaults
function.desc: Modify default settings for validation.
function.longdesc: Accepts everything that Plugins/Validation/validate accepts.

example.desc: Sets the debug setting for all validation calls.

function.name: addMethod
function.desc: Add a new validation method. It must consist of a name (must be a legal javascript identifier), a function and a default message.
function.longdesc:
Please note: While the temptation is great to add a regex method that checks it's paramter against the value, it is much cleaner to encapsulate those regular expressions inside their own method. If you need lots of slightly different expressions, try to extract a common parameter.
A library of regular expressions: http://regexlib.com/DisplayPatterns.aspx

params.name: name
params.desc: The name of the method, used to identify and referencing it, must be a valid javascript identifier

params.name: method
params.desc: The actual method implementation, returning true if an element is valid

params.name: message
params.desc: The default message to display for this method. Can be a function created by String.format(value).

example.desc: Add a validation method that checks if a value starts with a certain domain.
Adds a validation method that checks if a given value equals the addition of the two parameters.

function.name: required
function.desc: Makes the element always required.
function.longdesc:
Return false if the element is empty (text input) or unchecked (radio/checkbxo) or nothing selected (select).
Works with text inputs, selects, checkboxes and radio buttons.
To force a user to select an option from a select box, provide an empty options like <option value="">Choose...</option>

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" always required. Nothing and blanks are invalid.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"

});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes the fruit select required.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>

<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes the gender radio buttons required.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>

<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes the agree checkbox required.

function.name: required
function.desc: Makes the element required, depending on the result of the given expression.
function.longdesc:
Return false if the element is empty (text input) or unchecked (radio/checkbxo) or nothing selected (select).
Works with all kind of text inputs, selects, checkboxes and radio buttons.
To force a user to select an option from a select box, provide an empty options like <option value="">Choose...</option>

params.name: dependency-expression
params.desc: An expression (String) is evaluated in the context of the element's form, making the field required only if the expression returns more then one element.

example.desc: Makes "newsletter-type" required only if "newsletter" is checked.

function.name: required
function.desc: Makes the element required, depending on the result of the given callback.
function.longdesc:
Return false if the element is empty (text input) or unchecked (radio/checkbxo) or nothing selected (select).
Works with all kind of text inputs, selects, checkboxes and radio buttons.
To force a user to select an option from a select box, provide an empty options like <option value="">Choose...</option>

params.name: dependency-callback
params.desc: The function is executed with the element as it's only argument: If it returns true, the element is required.

example.desc: Makes "parent" required only if age is below 13.

function.name: minLength
function.desc: Makes the element require a given minimum length.
function.longdesc:
Return false, if the element is * some kind of text input and its value is too short * a set of checkboxes has not enough boxes checked * a select and has not enough options selected
Works with text inputs, selects and checkboxes.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required having at least 3 characters.

function.name: maxLength
function.desc: Makes the element require a given maxmimum length.
function.longdesc:
Return false, if the element is * some kind of text input and its value is too long * a set of checkboxes has too many boxes checked * a select and has too many options selected
Works with text inputs, selects and checkboxes.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required having at most 4 characters.

function.name: rangeLength
function.desc: Makes the element require a given value range.
function.longdesc:
Return false, if the element is * some kind of text input and its length is too short or too long * a set of checkboxes has not enough or too many boxes checked * a select and has not enough or too many options selected
Works with text inputs.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required and between 2 and 6 characters long.

function.name: minValue
function.desc: Makes the element require a given minimum value.
function.longdesc: Works with text inputs.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required and 13 or larger.

function.name: maxValue
function.desc: Makes the element require a given maximum value.
function.longdesc: Works with text inputs.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required and 23 or smaller.

function.name: rangeValue
function.desc: Makes the element require a given value range.
function.longdesc: Works with text inputs.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required and between 13 and 23.

function.name: email
function.desc: Makes the element require a valid email
function.longdesc:
Return true, if the value is a valid email address.
Works with text inputs.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required and an email address.

function.name: url
function.desc: Makes the element require a valid url
function.longdesc:
Return true, if the value is a valid url.
Works with text inputs.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required and a url.

function.name: date
function.desc: Makes the element require a date.
function.longdesc:
Return true, if the value is a valid date. Uses JavaScripts built-in Date to test if the date is valid, and is therefore very limited.
Works with text inputs.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required and a date.

function.name: dateISO
function.desc: Makes the element require a ISO date.
function.longdesc:
Return true, if the value is a valid date, according to ISO date standard.
Works with text inputs.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required and a ISO date.

function.name: dateDE
function.desc: Makes the element require a german date.
function.longdesc:
Return true, if the value is a valid date. Supports german dates (29.04.1994 or 1.1.2006). Doesn't make any sanity checks.
Works with text inputs.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required and a german date.

function.name: digits
function.desc: Makes the element require digits only.
function.longdesc:
Returns true if the value contains only digits.
Works with text inputs.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required and digits only.

function.name: creditcard
function.desc: Makes the element require a creditcard number.
function.longdesc:
Return true, if the value is a valid creditcard number.
Works with text inputs.

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required and a creditcard number.

function.name: accept
function.desc: Makes the element require a certain file extension.
function.longdesc:
Returns true if the value ends with one of the specified file extensions. If nothing is specified, only images are allowed (png, jpeg, gif).
Works with text inputs.

params.name: extension
params.desc: The allowed file extensions, seperated via "|", defaults to "png|jpe?g|gif"

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required and ending with ".xls" or ".csv".

function.name: equalTo
function.desc: Requires the element to be the same as another one
function.longdesc:
Returns true if the value has the same value as the element specified by the first parameter.
Works with text inputs.

params.name: other
params.desc: The selector for the element to compare the current values

example.inhead:
<script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/validate/jquery.validate.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">

jQuery.validator.setDefaults({
	debug: true,
	success: "valid"
});;
</script>
example.desc: Makes "field" required to be the same as #other

function.name: treeview
function.desc: Takes an unordered list and makes all branches collapsable.
function.longdesc:
The "treeview" class is added if not already present.
To hide branches on first display, mark their li elements with the class "closed". If the "collapsed" option is used, mark initially open branches with class "open".

params.name: options
params.desc: A set of key/value pairs that configure the treeview. All options are optional.

option.name: animated
option.desc: Speed of animation, see animate() for details, or no animation if not specified.

option.name: collapsed
option.desc: Start with all branches collapsed.

option.name: control
option.desc: Container for a treecontrol, allowing the user to expand, collapse and toggle all branches with one click.

option.name: unique
option.desc: Set to allow only one branch on one level to be open (closing siblings which opening).

option.name: toggle
option.desc: Callback when toggling a branch. Arguments: "this" refers to the UL that was shown or hidden. Works only with speed option set (set speed: 1 to enable callback without animations).

option.name: persist
option.desc: Persist the tree state in cookies or the page location. If set to "location", looks for the anchor that matches location.href and activates that part of the treeview it. Great for href-based state-saving. If set to "cookie", saves the state of the tree on each click to a cookie and restores that state on page load.

option.name: add
option.desc: Populate the tree with more nodes using this option and calling the plugin again. The selector must match elements that were added somewhere to the existing tree. Classes and event handlers are applied to match the behaviour of the existing tree.

example.desc: Creates a treeview and adds a button to add more branches to it.
example.inhead:
<link rel="stylesheet" href="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/treeview/jquery.treeview.css" type="text/css" media="screen" />

  <script type="text/javascript" src="http://dev.jquery.com/view/trunk/plugins/treeview/jquery.treeview.js"></script>
  <style type="text/css">
  #browser {
    font-family: Verdana, helvetica, arial, sans-serif;
    font-size: 68.75%;
  }
  </style>
example.html:
• Folder 1
    • Item 1.1
  • Folder 2
    • Subfolder 2.1
      • File 2.1.1
      • File 2.1.2
    • File 2.2
  • Folder 3 (closed at start)
    • File 3.1
  • File 4
